name: The Mansion Melbourne
description:
OVERVIEW
The Mansion Melbourne, has recently had a facelift of grand proportions and reopened. Here you will discover a fusion of chilled vibes, heritage charm, stylish spaces and a fabulous team, at your service, from 9am - 6:30pm Daily, and emergency after hours staff on call, 7 days a week. Featuring all of your cravable comforts such as free Wi-Fi, co-working spaces,'Movie Night Monday' - including popcorn & biscuits, lavish new beds, 'Board Games' every Thursday, Bar Open Fridays from 3pm to Late with a Backpacker BBQ from 6-7pm you'll feel at home right away! 

LOCATION
The Mansion is superbly located for all of your Melbourne escapades. A few paces to the left and you'll be in the CBD discovering Melbourne one laneway at a time. Cross the road, and you will be strolling down Brunswick Street in Melbourne's coolest inner-city suburb, Fitzroy. Or if you want some quiet time relaxing with a book in Carlton Gardens. With multiple free trams and Parliament Train Station within a stone's throw, you'll be living like a local in no time. 
 
ROOMS
The Mansion features 15 newly renovated rooms over three levels, connected by a grand double spiral staircase. Sound just a bit fancy? It is! Fitted out with new bunk beds complete with privacy curtain, luscious thick mattresses and pillows, a private bed light, power point and a locker, you’ll never want to leave. For those seeking solace from the heat in summer, we offer a whole floor with air-conditioning. 

Guests must be minimum 18 years of age.
All guests must provide a valid photo ID on check-in - physical I.D, not a copy
All guests must provide Visa/Mastercard credit/debit card on check-in.
Management reserve the right to refuse entry upon arrival.
Reception check in times are 1pm - 6:30pm Daily  
You are welcome to arrive early, from 9am to drop off bags and hang out in the hostel until check in 
Arriving after 6:30pm, that's okay our night manager on call will welcome you, this service is available till 10pm & 11:30pm on Fridays - please notify us prior to arrival if you are arriving late

Please note check ins, are not available after 10pm at night (except for Fridays 11:30pm) - for security reasons and the comfort of inhouse Guests - If you need a late check in after 10pm you will need to book alternative accommodation that offers late night arrival.

Hostel Code of Conduct:
* Clean up after yourself, including washing, drying, and putting away dishes after use    and before eating - clean as you cook.
* Guests are not permitted to possess or consume Alcohol in and on Hostel Grounds * 
The Mansion Hostel is exclusively for hostel Guests to enjoy, Visitors are not permitted in the Hostel but are welcome to Hang out in reception and the courtyard. 
* Listen to and follow all staff direction.

A breach of the following will result in immediate termination of reservation:
* Sneaking visitors into the hostel
* Smoking, Vaping, burning candles, or incense inside the hostel,
* Entering another guest’s room without their express consent.
* Possession, consumption or sale of Illicit drugs 
* Physical or verbal intimidation, abuse, and/or violence.
* Guests suspected of or caught stealing
hostelworldSays: Home at the Mansion was rated the most popular hostel in Melbourne at the 2011 Hoscars and no wonder - it\'s centrally located near Queen Victoria Market, Federation Square and Chinatown. Hostelworld guests have said this is ?a great hostel to arrive to in Melbourne, especially just getting off of a long flight?. This hostel has clean, bright and airy rooms with high ceilings and our users say they particularly appreciate the ?awesome courtyard with picnic tables/sun loungers/ping-pong table/dart board?. Several travellers tell us they plan to stay here again because ?weekends here are party central?.
hostelSays:
We're located in one of Melbourne's most impressive and striking heritage-listed building. Even though the building looks huge, we're one of Melbourne's smaller hostels so guests receive more personal service. We have free wine and cheese nights on Wednesdays and 'Sausage Sizzles' on Sundays on the BBQ. There's also regular social nights out, including bowling, footy nights, fancy dress pub crawls and more, plus free DVD hire, a PlayStation games area and a large, sunny garden complete with picnic tables and sun loungers, right smack in the middle of the city!
Our location means you can easily walk to many of Melbourne's major attractions such as Chinatown, Queen Victoria Markets, Melbourne Museum and many, many more! The free City Circle tram and tram 96 to St. Kilda beach leave from our doorstep. One of my favourite local areas is Brunswick St; it's literally a short stroll away, where guests can find many funky cafés offering a wide range of cheap meals along with some of the best and most unique shops in Melbourne. Brunswick St is also highly regarded for its pubs and bars, many offering a variety of different live music.
